_exec_summary.SummaryText:
The results are mitigated by the fact that most of the refrigeration equipment is inside the Cedar Rapids, Iowa facility?s building.

The facility has had no reportable ammonia releases within the last five years. To prevent and/or minimize any potential future release of anhydrous ammonia, Nash Finch Company is implementing a Process Safety Management (PSM) program (Preventative Program 3) developed for their facility in Cedar Rapids, Iowa. Preventative Program 3 provides extensive maintenance and operator/mechanic training to ensure system mechanical integrity is maintained for the life of the covered process. Program 3 also incorporates administrative controls when modifications are made to the covered process (ammonia refrigeration system), so that the training and preventative programs are updated as the system expands and changes.

Emergency response is discussed in Section 9 of this RMP. Nash Finch Company has an Emergency Response Plan (ERP) for their facility. The purpose of this plan is to provide the means for rapidly determining the appropriate response for any emergency that may develop at the facility such as an accidental release of anhydrous ammonia. Nash Finch Company will conduct scheduled drills of the emergency response plan. 

Nash Finch Company will incorporate or address practicable recommendations resulting from the Process Hazard Analysis, Offsite Consequences, Incident Investigations, and Program Audits. The flexibility of the program allows Nash Finch Company to respond effectively to prevent or minimize any potential of exposing Nash Finch Company employees, the surrounding public, and/or the environment to a release of anhydrous ammonia.
